document_title: Vaginal (private area) dryness: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Doctor Quy Khoa shared that most cases of vaginal dryness occur due to decreased Estrogen levels, which naturally occurs as women get older, when women enter menopause. Menopause is considered when the menstrual cycle has ended and a woman is no longer able to get pregnant.
"When Estrogen levels decrease, the skin and tissues of the vulva and vagina become thinner and less elastic, which can cause the vagina to become dry," Dr. Quy Khoa added.
Decreased estrogen levels are the main cause of vaginal dryness
In addition, some health conditions or medical treatments can also cause vaginal dryness, including: (2)
After giving birth and breastfeeding your baby.; Side effects of birth control pills or any hormonal contraceptive method.; Improper hygiene of private areas, frequent vaginal douching; The period of foreplay and stimulation before sex is not long enough for enough vaginal fluid to be secreted to lubricate the vagina.; Have diabetes.; Suffering from Sjogren's syndrome - an autoimmune disorder that can cause dryness throughout the body.; Using anti-Estrogen drugs in the treatment of diseases such as uterine fibroids and endometriosis; Use antidepressants or antihistamines in treatments such as treating itchy eyes and runny nose.; Are receiving cancer treatment such as chemotherapy or hormone therapy.; Had oophorectomy.
Reference: Instructions for properly cleaning private areas
